Mr. Ashboume Vocational Training: Canada: For honourably discharged veterans who, in the opinion of the Dept., will beneﬁt by training in effecting rehabilitation. Training is carried out in school and on-the» job. Length of training normally does not exceed 52 weeks but may be extended. The trainee may not receive allowances for a period longer than his period of service un- less a pensioner. Allowance rates per month are: single $60; married $80.”.

Mr. Ashbourne Disability Pensions: Canada: Pensions are awarded for disability resulting from injury or disease attributable to or incurred during service (insurance prin~ ciple).

The rate for l00% disability for all ranks below that of Captain (army) or equivalent is $900 per annum. Disabilities are assessed in multiples of 5% and the amounts vary ac— cordingly, For disabilities less than 5% a ﬁnal payment not exceeding $100 may be awarded. The rates are higher for Captain and above.
